Hundreds of people serving prison sentences for murder in California may soon be eligible for early release NPR's Martin Kaste reports on a new law signed by governor Jerry Brown
For decades California's felony murder law made it possible to charge people for murder even when they didn't commit the actual killing for instance a getaway driver at a bank robbery in which someone got killed could have been charged with murder even if he or she didn't see the death take place
